lead_paragraph: The doctor who took a stand decades ago against boxing argues that the N.F.L. must acknowledge the high risk of brain injury.

headline.print_headline: The N.F.L.’s Collision With the Future
headline.main: The N.F.L.’s Next Play: Address Brain Trauma or Fade Away

snippet: The doctor who took a stand decades ago against boxing argues that the N.F.L. must acknowledge the high risk of brain injury.
abstract: Op-Ed article by pathologist George D Lundbeg decries failure of NFL to protect players from concussion and brain damage; contends continued negligence by league may eventually result in its marginalization, mirroring diminished popularity of boxing as public became aware of its dangers; calls for NFL to publicly admit extent of brain damage risk and to implement rules aimed at reducing it.
